Articles.Content:
Hi, I've spent about 20 hours now trying to make a plane that will take off the ground. I spent all my research on the first aerodynamics package (MK1 parts), and all my money on a better runway. However, I never once got close to making a plane that can take off.

I've looked over many posts on this forum and others, adjusted the landing gear, aligned center of lift with center of mass, installed control surfaces for YPR, and it's still either incredibly unstable and explodes at 30 m/s, or never takes off and explodes at the end of the runway. 

What can I do at this point? Is it just impossible to make a plane with only the basic parts?

Press center off mass, aerodynamic overlay and center of thrust in the space plane hanger and press F1 when all the parts of your plane is clearly visible.

This will make a screenshot in your screenshot folder which is located in your ksp folder. Upload it to imgur and share the link here. It seems that your gear is to far behind your Com, insufficient control surfaces or bad landing gear settings.

This is a link to the screenshot: http://prntscr.com/bo9jbr

The first tank contains no fuel, and the second is full. I did this to adjust CoM and to make sure the plane was long enough. 

Edited July 3, 2016 by Nezhmetdinov

This is a different version I tried to make work: http://prntscr.com/boa8gf

Whenever its speed exceeds 20 m/s on the runway it starts swinging side to side until a wing hits the ground and the plane explodes. I reasoned that this is because the aerodynamic transfer function hits a pole, but there's no way to view these in the game, and no way to design a PID controller to handle any of the variables.

Edited July 3, 2016 by Nezhmetdinov
Max out spring strength and damper on rear wheels, place them closer to CoM, add second pair of them if needed. Suspension dynamics are one of the main plane killers in KSP atm.

Also try using the Ly-01 gear instead.

Here is a simple 28 part plane (if you don't count the nav lights) note the large wings and how close the center of mass and aerodynamic overlay are and note the extra landing gear which helps work out some of the short comings of basic landing gear.  This plane takes off very easily (just hit full throttle and point the nose up a bit), lands very easily (just flare it slightly when a meter off the ground/water and going under 50m/s).  Works as a boat too .

Spoiler

Like boris said, with those very early landing gear you need to put spring and dampening to max. These are sliders which you can set by right clicking on the landing gear.

Furthermore, I cannot see any "Pitch" control surfaces.

All I see is a "Main" wing.

There might be control surfaces attached to that wing unable to see at that picture, but for "Pitch" control surfaces you want them to be attached either far in front of the Center of mass (yellow orb) or far behind, like on the tail.

As is the case on real aircraft, so it should be on aircrafts in KSP. This explains why your aircraft does not take off. Place some control surfaces in 2 way symmetry at the tail. And use the Move : Tool and Rotate options to put them in the correction position. Right click on the control surfaces to put "Pitch" on and "Yaw" and "Roll" to off.

In case you do have pitch control surfaces on that main wing, then they will be very close to the center of mass, and they'll be innefective at pulling your nose up.

I looked at your screenshot. You need stabilizers. Put on some elevators in the back and that will assist with pretty much everything. 

Also, make it higher off the ground. It doesn't look like you have much room to rotate on takeoff. I don't know if this is a thing but your center of lift bubble is very small? I don't know what that means; whenever I make planes the center of lift bubble doesn't change size. Also for the nosewheel, disable the steering when going fast. The slightest nosewheel movement at high speeds is not good for the safety of the crew if you get what I'm saying. The A-10 Warthog has a special button on the joystick itself to disable the nosewheel's steering during takeoff. Assuming your plane is already pointed straight down the runway, you should be able to do the whole roll with it off.

6 hours ago, Nezhmetdinov said:

Is it just impossible to make a plane with only the basic parts?

No, it's not impossible. But some types of designs are easier to make work than other types. Canard-based designs are very easy, for example.

http://www.virtualrealitytoursllc.com/pix/basic_jet.craft
This was my first aircraft last game, iirc. FAR, but basic principles ( and part counts! ) are the same - you still need all parts of an aircraft no matter the aerodynamics used.
